_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Grain and Field Bean Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary


Facility:     Farmers Cooperative Company
                 Palmyra, NE 
Contact:    Ralph Arett
Phone:      402-780-5820

1.     Facility Policy.
        
        The owners, management and employees of Farmers Cooperative Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Otoe County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.

2.     Facility Information.

        The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  The maximum quantity stored would be 444,200 pounds in a storage tank and nurse tanks.



4.     Accidental Release Prevention Program

        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia".  The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b) and Nebraska State Fire Marshall Statutes (Sec. 81-501 et seq.) and Regulations.

5.      Five-Year Accident History.

         There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

6.       Emergency Action Plan.

          The facility has:

          a.     A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA).

c.

If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.  With-in 15 minutes of determining the amount of the release would be over 100 pounds, the Emergency Coordinator will notify:

1.  The National Emergency Response Center @ 800/424-8802
2.  The State Spill Reporting Agency @ 402-471-2186 or 4545
          
7.       Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

          Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions Farmers Cooperative Company.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
